title: Take your time.
text: The Englisher Garten (English Garden) in Munich is the largest city park in Europe.So if you want to visit the park including one of the restaurants and / or Biergartens, you need at least several hours.The most important sights in the park are a Chinese pagoda, a Japanese tea house, the Monopteros temple and also two Biergartens.The garden opened by the end of the 18th century.The name English Garden refers to the landscape style in which the garden is designed; it is a rather informal garden laid out in a style that was very popular in England during the late 18th and early 19th centuries.The park is larger than Central Park in New York and is divided into two sections: the Hirschau, the northern section is 3 kilometers long and the southern section is 2 kilometers long.The southern part is the busiest part of the park while the Hirschau is much quieter.

The English Garden is safer than Central Park at almost any time of day.   The southern (downtown side) is generally safe at night, but the upper reaches of the park can be dicey after dark.  Still assaults are rare enough to be front page news when they do, and you won't get shot..

title: A narrow but very long park. And very interesting experience of visiting it.
text: Literally a huge sausage along the Isar River. A couple of creeks also pass through the park, which pass through a pond at the Chinese Tower and end at a small waterfall, which is used by local surfers.My wife and I went around only 1/5 of the park, but even so we got an interesting impression. First, we met several groups of people swimming in a creek. Then we were very surprised to see an enormous number of people resting in open green areas with picnics. People with picnics also come out at our local park on weekends, but I have never seen so many people like here. Then we went to the Chinese Tower, which had food service stalls, fenced with a pass system and many tables at which people ate. Near the tower was a restaurant with beautiful architecture. Then, when we went further, we once again saw an open area with a large number of vacationers, and another bathing place. This time there were stones with a small waterfall from which they coped on rubber rings. At the end of the park, on a small island, there was a Japanese tea house, which we didn't get in because of the long waiting line. And on the other side there was a place fiercely chosen by surfers and their fans, since there they could ride on a stream of water emerging in the creek. Very interesting park and experience visiting it. I think on another day it would be deserted, so if you visit it, I highly recommend doing it on a day off or some holiday.

text: Easy to access, this huge garden is right in the center of Munich and offers a buffer for every local and tourist to visit and enjoy. There is so much choice - sausages, pasta, noodles, meatloaf, chips etc. As well as huge glasses of beer: including non alcoholic, shandy and soft drinks. Not cheap but excellent fun. title: Runs, floating, relaxing
text: Great spot with so many different trails and spots for different activities.As mostly a runner there, the trails are fantastic and you can get great circuits throughout without getting bored or feeling trapped. Great balance of shade and sun for different weather patters.Great spot on a really hot day as there are heaps of spots by the streams to either dunk in or float, a popular pass time for locals either on small inflatables or just lying on their backs. As large as it is, you never feel crammed, even on weekend sunny days.Also so many spots for sports and other activities on the many lawns. Beer gardens are either within the park or right by it, making it easy to have a typical German experience.Not as many washrooms without having to walk further and not really any water fountains. Tough for longer runs in hot weather, though there are kiosks for buying water (not ideal though).If you're lucky you may see a true local on a warm summers day strolling naked after a good float on the stream.

title: Awesome lush green haven in the middle of the city
text: We were completely bowled over by this lush green spot smack in the middle of Munich. Actually an entire day is required to do full justice to this amazing place. Being a really hot day we could see quite a few swimmers merrily floating past. There's even a delightful surfing spot where many surfers could be seen eagerly awaiting their turn. The place has nearly 80 km of walkways and a lake too. The beer garden (within the English garden) with a seating capacity of 7000 is another must visit spot for a 1ltr special mug. One can also try the three wheeler rickshaw ride in the garden if you would rather prefer a laid back look around. I could go on and on. But let me wind up by saying that it took me completely by surprise as it's a totally 'wow' place. If you're on holiday in Munich, especially first time, make sure you do not miss this 'must visit' spot.Cheers,Raghu & Deepa

title: Garden party
text: Regarded as one of Munich's must-see stops, I'll admit the Englischer Garten wasn't actually all that high on my priority list. I'm not the most 'at one' with nature, but still felt I had to at very least take a look at this lush area of greenery in the heart of a very modern city, so early one morning off I set. The gardens are fairly sizable, and while for the most part it is grassy plains, there are also plenty of trees as well as numerous small ponds and streams, which ensure it has a large collective of birds running wild to admire. The remarkably large expanse the gardens cover, coupled with my early morning timeframe for visit meant it was a favourite with dog walkers, but I can imagine on a sunny day it will attract more than its fair share of families and picnics. On top of this, the garden does boast more than natural beauty, of which make no mistake it has plenty. Scattered throughout are a variety of minor attractions ranging from a greek style pantheon style monument to the more famous Japanese pagoda, which boasts a small beer garden which infuriatingly I was too early to take advantage of. Likewise there was nobody taking advantage of the artificial wave created with is a popular inner-city surfing spot. Overall, I'd say I enjoyed my jaunt through the Englischer Garten. Yes it isn't my normal cup of tea, but for an early morning stroll it cleared the cobwebs nicely, and for those more in tune with nature it is genuinely lovely. I imagine visiting in the afternoon would be better to be able to take in a beer, but at the same time have my reservations about how busy it would be. In short, I'd recommend taking a stroll through it if you find yourself in Munich, its free and hard to find fault in, it just isnt' necessarily my type of thing.

title: Pretty, relaxing - rent a bike
text: We were on a bike tour that took us through this large swath of green garden in the center of bustling Munich. All the locals escape here - you will see people sunning themselves (with or without clothing), surfing the river, drinking beer in the HUGE Chinese beer garden, or just meandering the many paths. There is a bike rental place on the east side of the gardens.

title: Family wisit
text: Easy walk, nice restaurants and tolilets and playing grounds for kids every now and then. I whished my girls were younger, this could have been a nice day trip in the garden.

title: English gardens
text: English gardens was spectacular. Watched the river surfers and had a great meal at one of the beer gardens.

title: Must see
text: The walk inside the English Garden was pleasant. Stop at the Chinese tower and have beer and sausages. They are better than in Marienplatz

title: English Gardenüëå

title: SERENITY IN THE MIDDLE OF MUNICH
text: The English Garden is a a wonderful place to find peace and calm in the middle of bustling Munich.  The park is huge, with miles of well tended walking paths, and is a good place to go if you want to just walk, throw a blanket on the grass and enjoy the sun, or watch others enjoy their day.  The park is adjacent to Old Town (Altstadt), and is easily accessible.

title: Beautiful park
text: This large area was filled with people and families out having picnics and playing sports. It was a lovely day and I‚Äôm glad I walked the distance to visit.

title: Bike the day away
text: Rent a bike from Mike's Bikes and spend the day riding through the Gardner stopping along biergartens as you go. Affordable and efficient way to see a huge park! I was amazed at the size  of the park based in Hyde Park and NYC Central Park. Quite beautiful and fun!

title: Beautiful park in the city
text: What a gem! This park is huge and so very clean and in the heat actually it was cool in the park. Beautiful park for a run, or just a nice walk. Big areas just to relax and get some sun, swimming in the cool Isar. Big Biergarten with good food. Loved it,

title: Surprise in Munich.
text: Wasn‚Äôt sure what to expect but Mum loves gardens so we spent a morning here. Was a massive surprise to find nearly 1000 acres of diverse garden in central Munich. We walked from approximately the middle all the way to the embassy and back. Had lunch in the beer garden in the middle. Easily spent four hours without seeing half. This would be amazing in the different seasons. Would love to come back in autumn.

title: Great place to hang out on a summers day.
text: Visited in on a sunny weekday afternoon, park was full of people having fun. Lots of places to cycle and walk. Food area near in the middle has great food and beer. You can even surf if you are brave.

title: English Garden is beautiful
text: A beautiful park to walk, run, cycle and take the kids out for the day, we were quite shocked to find a few naked tanners along the Isar river, but apparently that is a common site in Munich. I suppose it is always good to get a good dose of Vitamin D. The grounds are beautifully maintained and we loved the area by the ducks.  The wave surfers were also a great site to see.  I think the garden was one of our favourite places to visit in Munich, just understand everything only opens after 12 for service.

title: Worth a visit
text: Fabulous park. It‚Äôs huge would need a bike to see it all. We went on a bike tour that took us through. We had a beer in the middle in a pagoda.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Amazing
text: Amazing you can hang out there and have a drink everyone is enjoying the sun and swimming in the river or just chilling aroundReccomend in summer

title: Excellent spot for a break
text: Stopped here while on a bicycle tour of Munich. Excellent service, lovely atmosphere and beer, entertained by a fabulous brass band. Highly recommended. Watched some super surfers.

title: The public beer garden was entertaining and lively.
text: The well-known beer garden lived up to its reputation. We enyoyed sunny weather, the large and inexpensive German beers, and the oompah band.  For added entertainment, we spectated at the surfing wave on the canal within the park.  All streams in the area were running high, so surfers were found it challenging to get on the wave.

title: We had so much fun here
text: It's a huge green park smack in the middle of Munich. A walking distance from Odeonplatz metro stop. There is a lake and the famous Chinese Garden. But the highlight is the couple of clean and cold water streams running right through the park. The water is only 2 feet deep and its a great way to cool off on a hot summer day. A lot of families, young people and students have beer, swim and sun themselves whole day. Very clean despite the crowd. The crowd is great and I was very comfortable with my family. Its a must visit and spend half a day here. Have a couple of beers and take a cool dip. There is a fun paddle boat ride in the lake.

title: Chinese Tower was fun to eat at
text: It was a long walk in to the Tower, but it was worth the walk along the river.  Pretty scenery, and the huge biergarten at the tower was fun to eat at.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Swimming in heat wave
text: Great place to cool down.  Swift moving Eisbach River.  Love the biergartens throughout the park.  Get a bicycle for the day and enjoy.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Fantastic park!
text: If you like parks this is a must. It‚Äôs huge, on a nice sunny day it‚Äôs a fantastic place for a stroll, bike ride, or if you‚Äôre athletic go for a jog or run. It‚Äôs well used by the locals. During summer don‚Äôt be surprised to to see lots of sun bathers, & some that are nude. There are a few waterways that traverse the park. At two different spots you‚Äôll see surfers in wet suits surfing wave currents. Which is rather unique.

title: beautiful and surprising
text: It was very hot while we were in germany but a trip to the English Garden and the beer garden was refreshing. We even were entertained by the surfers that surf in the man=made brook and swimmers that float down the not at all lazy river!

title: auemister
text: beautiful garden near to our hotel rilano doma street. you have auemister restaurant inside it open till 8 pm only.

title: Amazing must-visit place in Munich
text: I absolutely loved this place. It is walking distance from the centre but the train is easier and quicker. Huge park with smaller beer huts and seating areas dotted around where you might see some local bands performing however the main attraction is the massive sprawling beer garden by the chinese tower. Loads of seating, bands playing on the pavilion, large selection of food in the service area. Food and drink reasonably priced. It's incredible to think a place like this exists. No security around but no need. It's pleasant, fun, area for groups of friends or even families to sit in the sun. This would last two minutes in England before yobs ruined it, but the culture in Munich is so different. You easily spend an afternoon here and should do.

title: Perfect for a sunny day
text: Our first stop was the surfers at the entrance to the park, fun to watch as they battled the current.  Next we sunbathe at the rivers edge. The river is quite shallow but the current is strong, so the kids enjoyed floating down stream, getting out walking back, and doing it all again! Perfect spot to spend s hot afternoon.

title: Amazing Garden
text: Such a large garden with lots of things to do, especially swim in the rivers. Nice to see soo many locals enjoying their city

title: Swimming in the river was the highlight
text: A beautiful lush garden, you could walk round for hours and never get bored.  The Isar River runs through it with quite a strong current which will allow you to swim down river which is great fun although you have to be a bit careful.  Nice restaurants a Chinese tower and great beer provide a wonderful environment to spend the day .  You can hire pedalos and little boats and spend half an hour basking on the smallLake.  Really enjoyed our day there .

title: Graduation Trip
text: My husband described the English Garden as paradise. Beautiful, extremely large park with a lovely stream running through the middle. Very laid back and family oriented. Hofbrau Haus Biergarten was awesome. The food was out of this world! If you ever get to Munich it‚Äôs a must see.

title: Great public space
text: This is a gigantic park with a little bit for everyone. There are miles of trails to walk or ride your bike, beer gardens, sunbathing (some clothing optional), swimming and floating in the canal, surfing, sports fields, people with picnics and lots of other things that I missed because I was only walking through for a few hours. Beautiful natural space.

title: A perfect lazy afternoon
text: If you have some extra time, take a few hours stroll the grounds of this magnificent park. In the summer, you'll catch people swimming on the streams and even if you forgot your swimsuit, you'll have an awesome time people watching. At the head of the park, there's a spot where people actually surf. Yes, in landlocked Munich, there's a fascinating surf spot! A must see.

title: Beautiful park with clean rivers
text: This place is popular for a reason: it's an excellent place to enjoy a beer and relax.  I visited on a particularly hot day and the clean rivers were full of people cooling off and having a great time.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Rent a bike and explore
text: One of the most beautiful places in the world! Take a picnic and find your fav spot! Unbelievable place.

title: Great Garden
text: English Garden is one of the biggest garden that I have seen.There are walking and cycling paths depending on how you want to explore. There is a lake. Famous Chinese tower is located in this garden
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Ideal for bicycling
text: We very much enjoyed bicycling through the park fin the sunshine. Streams,lakes, ducks, and semi-dressed sunbathers are interspersed amidst trees and lawns. Beer tents abound. A delightful respite in the middle of an urban environment.

title: Beautiful and tranquil city park.
text: We went to the English Garden to see the Christmas Fair there, which was completely and utterly delightful - probably the "craftiest" of the markets in Munich.  The walk across the English Garden was also delightful, with flocks of geese feeding on the grass, and the river burbling gently in the background.  This is so easy to reach from the city centre, and, from memory, in the summer is just utterly lovely.  Well worth a visit, if nothing else, then for the sense of tranquility.

title: Beautiful gardens and relaxing walks
text: A spectacular garden with lots to take in - from relaxing in the sun to floating down the streams to watching the very cool surfing. Great way to unwind - and if you fancy you can also enjoy a cold ale in one of the many bars around the garden

title: Oasis in Munchen

visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Pretty Park

title: Peaceful place

title: Delightful park

visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Fantastic Park
text: We always choose a hotel near the English Garden when staying in Munich.  Peaceful and quiet, it is an oasis in the middle of a bustling city. I was surprised that I felt safe walking solo through the park in early evening (not completely dark)Highly recommend
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Countryside
text: Plenty of open space and a beer garden in the center.  Worth the walk and takes the heat of city away for a few hours.

title: One of the most beautiful parks worldwide
text: The English garden is simply awesome. Why? Simple. It starts at the Prinzregentenstrasse at the museum Haus der Kunst with the famous Munich surfers (all year long even at -10 Celsius). Just move north and look to your left any you shall discover a Japanese tea house. Maybe you are lucky and you join a Japanese tea ceremony. Along th e small river further up north in summer you will see a lot of swimmers and people sun bathing. You enter a big grass area and to your right you see on a small hill the Monopteros. Just a bit further and you reach the Chinese Tour Beergarden. On weekends you might enjoy the life music. Now follow always north to the Kleinhesseloher See. A small lake with some little boats and yes your are right another beer garden. Some people think this is it but that is not true at all. Just cross the bridge behind the restaurant over the road and you enter the north part of the garden. The more you head up north the wilder the park gets. Amazing! Truly romantic and if you have the time. Just being a blanket and food and drinks, a book etc. and you will find so many hidden places where you can enjoy privacy in the middle of a buzzling city. You can follow the trails til you leave actually the city. So in principal the Central Park in New York is bigger but actually if you add the wilderness to the park, the English garden is far bigger. Do not miss this experience!

title: Biking and Beer Gardens!
text: We had the BEST day here.  We rented bikes from Mike's down Mike's Big Rentals, Kanalstra√üe 17, which is very close to the entrance of the gardens. They also have tours, but this is not hard.  The guy who rented the bikes was really helpful with a map and directions. There are 4 beer gardens in the park.  First stop was Eisbach Wave to watch the surfers.  From there we went to the Beer Garden at the Chinese Tower.  Early in the ride, it's crowded with walkers, but the best thing about riding is you can get much further into this beautiful park.  We stopped at three of the beer gardens, then looped around and came down by the river on the opposite shore. It was a great day. Drink and bike responsibly and you will have a lot of fun!
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Nice place to visit and spend time in the midst of nature

title: Lovely place

visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Great people watching-check out the surfers!

title: LOVE this. Such a beautiful place to relax right in the middle of the city.

visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Green acres with water and shade

title: Lovely

title: Amazing place
text: We had a few days in Munich mainly to visit nearby Neuwanstein Castle but on the last day my husband mentioned the Englisch Garten. I had no idea what to expect but was amazed when we arrived. We so enjoyed walking the many trails and being by water (and surfers!), enjoying food pavilions and entertainment with German bands. The only negative which really put me in a bad mood on vacation was the hostile bathroom worker near the Chinese area. I went in quickly and did not see the tip jar -it was crowded and I waited too long. Coming out of the stall I was trying to wash my hands and a worker cane up to me and started slamming her mop intentionally on my feet in sandals and making comments I could not understand that sounded angry. I ended up dropping part of my paper towel as she had me so rattled and she flipped out. I then glanced and saw the tip jar. It really ruined part of the day for me. I am a generous person, just did not know. Next restroom I visited the worker was at a table with her jar I gave her a lot and life was good again. Shameful behavior by employee though -I was mistreated and did not appreciate this post bunion surgery.

title: SO peaceful!
text: What a beautiful and peaceful park!  My wife and I enjoyed the bier garden at the Chinese Tower and some tasty gelato, but mostly enjoyed just sitting on one of the benches and soaking in the Bavarian sun and watching people as they enjoyed the park.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Bike or walk!
text: Our party split into two groups and half walked and half biked -- the park is enormous and we had a gorgeous day!  Loved the surfers on the river, the Chinese tower, the "Kiera Knightley" (can't remember what this feature is actually called but gorgeous view of the city!), and our favorite was the biergarten at Seehaus -- we were under a tree on couches watching swans on the lake and completely lost track of time!

title: Great outdoor space
text: We loved walking through the whole park--stopping for beers, watching the families and surfers, and just enjoying the ambience.

title: Perfect for bikes
text: Our family took a little ride through the park on our first day in Munich - it was perfect! Leave the hustle and bustle of city behind and ride easy through the gardens. Be sure to catch the river surfers!

title: Great outdoor experience.
text: A nice place to walk and relax(probably tan in the summer). Inside you will find a few beer gardens. My personal favorite : Restaurant & Biergarten at the Chinese Tower.

title: Great for early morning walk!
text: Feeling the effects of jet lag, I went for a walk through this park at 5am just as the sun was rising and it was well worth it - beautiful, green, quiet (except for the chirping birds!), and quite clean.  Saw quite a few squirrels and heard a lot of things moving in the bushes (deer?) Looks just like an authentic forest but with well marked walking trails.

title: A Munich "Must See"
text: There's not a lot I can say that hasn't already been said. Suffice to say that if you visit Munich in any season other than winter, you must experience the English Garden.You can easily fill half a day here, if not more.  I highly recommend doing it on a bike.  The garden is huge and trying to cover it all on foot can be tiring and time consuming.  Be sure to stop at the Chinese Tower biergarten for beer and brats, and if you have kids with you, let them spend some time splashing in the streams.  Then, top off your visit watching the surfers at the south end of the park.

title: Great place
text: We loved our time in the garden. The river was clean and refreshing. The people were having a great time. I could have spent the whole day here. Really lovely.

title: Perfect activity for hot weather
text: We visited Munich in June and I was not anticipating how hot it would be.  If I had know, I would have brought swimsuits for the kids to enjoy the beautiful water.  This was one of the most picturesque places we saw in Munich.  I would recommend bringing a picnic lunch to enjoy by the cool water.  It is huge and there are so many fun little places to eat while walking around.  We also found several places to stay as we were walking around that seemed like they would be so fun to stay at.  You might also enjoy renting some bikes to ride around to see as much as you can.

title: Local scene
text: My husband and I came here a couple of times and enjoyed seeing the locals enjoy their time away from work. Most people were college-age and young adults but people of all ages were there. They were actively engaged in play, sports, and talking. It was nice to see none were engrossed in their phones. Many were drinking beer from glass bottles but they picked up after themselves and we didn‚Äôt see any rowdiness.

title: Best garden ever
text: It is an amazing garden in which you enjoy walking around. It has a beautiful lake as well. It is in the middle between restaurants and coffee shops and some hotels.

title: Anazing
text: Exactly what it says on the tin. Great place to relax and unwind. While the food and beer offerings are good as well. So close to the city but feels so far away once you are in.

title: Absolutely worth the ride

visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Relaxing walk in Munich

visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Beautiful gardens
text: The gardens were green, shady and lovely to walk around. We ate a traditional German lunch with beer!

title: Oktoberfest trip
text: Amazin place to walk, do excerisce, read, rest, etc, even to drink a good beer or only watche the green trees
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Beauuuuuuuutiful
text: Well it was a great day in the English Garden. We (my daughter and I) took off our shoes and put our feet in the freezing water. Wow it was so cooling. Don't always trust the weather broadcast and take an umbrella with you. It rained so hard we went back home soaked.

title: Watch out for summer downpours!
text: Lovely garden.  You can meander in multiple directions.  Lots of water.  But watch the sky!  We got soaked in a deluge.  Luckily the Chinese beer garden let us in!

title: Great Place to be Outdoors
text: Rent a bike, bring a picnic (and a bathing suit). This is a great place to people watch, cruise around the many trails on a bike. On a nice evening you will find hundreds (perhaps thousands) of locals hanging in the park, swimming in the very cold creeks and rivers, sunbathing, sharing a beer (or several). There are several Beer Haus locations scattered throughout. My spouse and I absolutely loved spending time here
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Beautiful place
text: We are a family of four and went to the English Garden to escape the city. We had so much fun. We started our day by watching the surfers on the river (I highly recommend checking it out). Then we walked around and found our way to the Chinese Beer Garden. The food and of course the beer were amazing. There is live music and you could easily sit there all day. We next found a bike for my youngest son to rent (you download the app) and meandered through the garden to find a nice spot for swimming. My oldest son had a blast jumping into the current and riding it with all the other people. The water is freezing but certainly cools you off in a hot day.

title: Munich's Central Park

title: Nice park in the Schwabing area

title: Very large park

visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Beautiful garden

title: Nice for a sunny day
text: We went to the nothern part of the park - there was a lovely area with lots of outdoof seating, and a bar / resturant. What a lovely place to be on a sunny day. There  was also a kids park.Didn't see any of these nudists that people keep mentioning.

title: Unique to Munich
text: Great place to relax and enjoy a beer in the famous garden. Not the cheapest but a must on the visit to Munich.
visit: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

title: Don't miss the surfers

title: June 2018: Large, English style park in the middle of a city; great for kids and relaxing
text: The park is very large.   We didn't have enough time to walk through it all.  In June the weather was hot, humid, or cold and raining.  If you have small children, there are lots of areas to run around, play games, fly kites, etc.  I would recommend taking a picnic to enjoy in the shade.   Several streams run through the park, and I saw folks swimming in them.   I'd be careful as the streams in some areas were very fast - verging on rivers and cold as they are could be a risk to weak swimmers and youngsters.  Exercise sound judgement, always.  As usual, you won't find any water fountains, so you'll need to pack water bottles.  When we visited, the park seemed relatively crowded for such a large space.  if there's a hint of rain, take along an umbrella or you'll get soaked.  Note that a number of roads bisect the park, so be very careful and cross only at marked intersections. Getting there:  don't drive.   Use buses or a taxi.  It's also walking distance from subway stops.Eating: pack your own, and you can use a table at a biergarten.  Buy something, like a beer, to be polite.  Don't worry - you won't be the only ones. How to visit: I'd recommend seeing it in bits and pieces - on the way to or from - or maybe dedicate a few hours to one end of the park one day, another bit the next.   don't try to do it all in a day - It'd be a wee bit boring, from my perspective.   That said, by all means go.   It's a great relaxing time - in a park.

title: Enjoy the walk and sightseeing in this beautiful Garden
text: I always put a time to do a walking and enjoying a public park during my vacation trip. Find this lovely garden in Munich, called The Englischer Garten (The English Garden). English Garden is a huge public park right in the centre of Munich, one of the world's largest urban public parks. The name refers to its English garden form of informal landscape, a style popular in England from the mid-18th Century to the early 19th century and particularly associated with Capability Brown. Walking around English Garden, you could enjoy the Japanese teahouse, surfing, Monopteros "Apollo Temple", Chinese tower, Steinerne Bank, and many more (As I could not finish walk around less than 1 hour) If you are an outdoor person and enjoy walking, absolutely you need to visit this English Garden

text: This has been described as the lungs of the city. It is a huge green place and only 15 minutes walk or the same by U-Bahn and foot from the Marienplatz in the city centre. This seems the place where Munichers and their dogs seem to come to walk and relax. There are a number of outdoor eateries/bars the best of which seems to be the Chinese Tour - Chinesischer Turm. It has bars and fast food outlets in the Munich style at moderate prices (deposit on your beer glass) all in the open air. There is also a spot on the river where Munichers can surf - really.  If you have spare time and the weather is at all good then go to the Englischer Garten for an hour or two.

title: Beautiful garden, interesting to watch river surfing
text: The English Garden looked stunning with all the autumn gold leaves yesterday.  It was particularly poignant 100 year anniversary at 11am on 11 Nov to hear closeby church bells ringing as the golden leaves continuously fluttered to the ground like a tribute to the WWI fallen. The park is very well kept so we were surprised to see a bike in the river. The river surfing is interesting to watch for a few minutes and the little tributaries give you pretty photo opportunities. The highest spot gives a good view of Munich rooftops.Many happy dogs roam the park off lead. Many people ride bikes through the park so keep your eyes out for speeding cyclists.The park is a few minutes walk from Odeonsplatz station. You can either walk down the straight main road and take a right turn followed by another straight road or you can head through the archway next to starbucks near the station and head through another beautiful garden on the way to the English garden.

title: A beautiful large park
text: The English Garden is really a super large and beautiful park, stretching from the city centre to the northeastern city limits. So perfectly for having super long walks, or just having a picknick. Watch out, not to get lost there, because it is so huge! ;) Nevertheless of course, you are allowed to sit down wherever you want so for example close to that river called "Eisbach". Really nice! In the park among other things one can find the popular "Eisbach surver" surving there all time of the year on an artificial wave outside! Awesome! *must-see*In summer it is also possible to visit the beergarden at the Chinese Tower in the English garden, where you can nowadays listen to traditional old fashioned Bavarian music, while enjoying maybe a soft drink or beer. In summary: if you visit Munich you should go there for sure!

title: ENGLISH GARDEN WALK
text: We took a bus to get us near the English Garden.  It was a very nice relaxing walk through the paths.  The garden was very nice and the highlight was watching the surfers taking their turn to enter the water to surf the rough water near the bridge.  When one rides the waves and then falls the next surfer enters the water on the other side of the river.  It is very entertaining to watch and on a hot day a good way to cool off under the trees.  We walked all across the park and then took a rickshaw ride back.  It was a fun thing to do.
